channel.title: Edit look of inventory buttons & minimap
channel.description:
I have been researching on the internet for a couple days trying to figure out how to change the inventory screen. When i say this i mean the buttons the look of the minimap i am just talking about the asthetics of them. Could someone tell me about how i would go about doing that.. And if this is a hard task or not. Thank you
-Bebew

item.title: Edit look of inventory buttons & minimap
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“Bebew67, post:8, topic:450122”]@team rocket sorry i have done this twice lol i will be sure to put it under client next time
@kingman002 Yes i did and i was able to change them but when i finished changing them this is what i was left with. As you can see there are a bunch of errors one being the transparent parts under the minimap the black bar on the chat. Do you know how to fix that?[/quote]
I don’t, sorry. I’ve never encountered that problem. You said you were using Delta so download a 317 deob with 377 cache. That has the old gameframe. If you hardcoded any items or sprites just re-add them. That’s all I can say to help.

Read full topic

What client are you using?

item.title: Edit look of inventory buttons & minimap
item.dc:creator: @Bebew67 Bebew67
item.description:
@Bebew67 wrote:

Okay i think you understand what i mean. i took your advice i got Toms cache editor and some sprites that i wanted to use but i am kind of confused. just for example this is what i want to do…

Read full topic
item.source: Edit look of inventory buttons & minimap

item.title: Edit look of inventory buttons & minimap
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

If you mean the picture of how it looks then download a program called Toms Cache Editor. After you download that load your client’s cache into it. Then click View/Edit image archives. Then select Media. Then find which sprite you want to edit. After that, export the sprite. Save it as a .png, and then edit it to how you want. The pink (if there is any) is to make that part transparent, so if there is any don’t remove it. After you edit it, import the edited image that HAS to be a .png it should but done. Then click save archive and run your client.

Read full topic
